trans:
ğŸ“Œ Again using the example of the neighbours' romance, you started the piece by describing the moment they bumped into each other for the first time. The two soon take a slight interest in each other, but then separate.
ğŸ“Œ What's next? What should be done after that? How will they see each other again and how will they become closer?
ğŸ“Œ Ideas start to pop up and get mixed up with each other. The main characters need a bridge to unite them, something to motivate them to keep meeting. This bridge can be represented in a variety of things, from a shared hobby to a suddenly created enmity. they might go to the same place, or maybe have a friend in common.
Faced with so many options, it's normal for some people to give up on the story due to not deciding which of the various paths to follow.
On the other hand, there are also those people who manage to choose a path after a long time of thinking about the possibilities but still suffer some consequences like the one I see most often around here
